paragraphs.1: Takes note of the report of the Secretary-General;
paragraphs.2: Endorses the conclusions and recommendations contained in the report of the Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions.
paragraphs.3: Also reaffirms that the Fifth Committee is the appropriate Main Committee of the General Assembly entrusted with responsibility for administrative and budgetary matters;
paragraphs.4: Further reaffirms rule 153 of its rules of procedure;
paragraphs.5: Reaffirms that the support account funds shall be used for the sole purpose of financing human resources and non-human resources requirements for backstopping and supporting peacekeeping operations at Headquarters, and that any changes in this limitation require the prior approval of the General Assembly;
paragraphs.6: Also reaffirms the need for adequate funding for the backstopping of peacekeeping operations, as well as the need for full justification for that funding in support account budget submissions;
paragraphs.7: Further reaffirms the need for effective and efficient administration and financial management of peacekeeping operations, and urges the Secretary-General to continue to identify measures to increase the productivity and efficiency of the support account;
paragraphs.8: Requests the Secretary-General to ensure the full implementation of the relevant provisions of its resolutions 59/296 of 22 June 2005, 60/266 of 30 June 2006, 61/276 of 29 June 2007, 64/269 of 24 June 2010, 65/289 of 30 June 2011, 66/264 of 21 June 2012, 69/307 of 25 June 2015, 70/286 of 17 June 2016 and 76/274 of 29 June 2022, and its other relevant resolutions;
paragraphs.9: Endorses the conclusions and recommendations contained in the report of the Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions, and requests the Secretary-General to ensure their full implementation;
paragraphs.10: Decides to maintain, for the financial period from 1 July 2025 to 30 June 2026, the funding mechanism for the support account used in the current period, from 1 July 2024 to 30 June 2025, as approved in paragraph 3 of its resolution 50/221 B; Budget performance report for the period from 1 July 2023 to 30 June 2024
paragraphs.11: Takes note of the report of the Secretary-General on the budget performance of the support account for peacekeeping operations for the period from 1 July 2023 to 30 June 2024; Budget estimates for the financial period from 1 July 2025 to 30 June 2026
paragraphs.12: Approves the support account requirements in the amount of 425,636,500 United States dollars for the financial period from 1 July 2025 to 30 June 2026, inclusive of the amount of 18,904,600 dollars under enterprise resource planning, 626,700 dollars for death and disability claims for closed peacekeeping operations, 868,500 dollars for improved service delivery (previously the efficiency model for management services and the global service delivery model project), 3,326,800 dollars for peacekeeping capability readiness, 19,573,000 dollars for Umoja maintenance and support costs and 15,247,700 dollars for after-service health insurance costs, including 1,337 continuing posts, 107 new temporary posts and 1 new United Nations Volunteer position, 78 continuing and 6 new general temporary assistance positions and 52 person-months, as well as related post and non-post requirements, as well as the abolishment, redeployment and reassignment of posts and general temporary assistance positions; Financing of the support account for peacekeeping operations for the financial periods from 1 July 2023 to 30 June 2024 and from 1 July 2025 to 30 June 2026
paragraphs.13: II Support account and related funding issues Recalling its resolution 77/304, Having considered the report of the Secretary-General on the support account and related funding issues 5 and the related report of the Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions,6
